The discussion of switching to a decentralized alternative to Github seems to have moved on.  Although, I'd like to also add that I think looking at the threat-model should help decide what aspect of a Github alternative should be evaluated.
In my observation, Github seems to be a threat in moderating forum posts with actions like banning Draftbot for example
Which is why I suggest some self moderated version of a forum that is locally hosted

hebasto: our vcpkg caching in CI looks a bit busted to me. It seems to take ~40 mins each run, with virtually no cache hits, e.g. https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/actions/runs/21136611582/job/60780035656?pr=34296#step:9:281 Can we fix the cache keys to hit better somehow? Or perhaps we should investigate something like

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/vcpkg/consume/binary-caching-github-packages?pivots=windows-runner ? I'm afraid I'm such a windows n00b I don't really know whats going wrong to know which approach might be best to look at first :(
willcl-ark: i'll take a look
thanks!

Ok, starting with the WGs...
#topic Fuzzing WG Update (dergoegge)
nothing from my side
#topic Kernel WG Update (sedited)
stickies-v opened a PR for splitting up higher and lower level logging functionality and exposing richer logging information in the kernel API: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34374
hi
hi
hi
hi
That's it I guess? :)

alexanderwiederin presented some work using a copy-on-write CChain replacement for removing the need to lock cs_main in various small rpc calls (i.e. getblockcount). Still WIP, but can be viewed here: https://github.com/alexanderwiederin/bitcoin/commits/chain-concurrency/
oh, nvm :D
sorry, lost my ssh connection briefly :P
I've also resurrected my branch for an abstract block store, though I'll hold off on submitting a PR for the near future.
that's it.
#topic Benchmarking WG Update (l0rinc, andrewtoth)
Started measuring varops budgets on the benchmarking suite of different nodes for the Great Script Restoration proposal.
We found some bugs in the current benchmark (a few missing ops such as LSHIFT/RSHIFT and an always-empty SUBSTR) so we're remeasuring everything.
And opened a Coins Cache Cleanup tracker issue to help reviewers piece together the structure for the UTXO handling PRs #34280
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/34280 | Coins Cache Cleanup checklist  Issue #34280  bitcoin/bitcoin  GitHub
We finally have proper native Windows benchmark results for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31132#issuecomment-3767758819: the ~30% speedup reproduces on GCC there as well.
andrewtoth?
No update from me. More review on #31132 is welcome. It looks like it's faster on every platform.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31132 | validation: fetch block inputs on parallel threads 3x faster IBD by andrewtoth  Pull Request #31132  bitcoin/bitcoin  GitHub
#topic Cluster Mempool WG Update (sdaftuar, sipa)
Priority remains #34257, which I welcome more conceptual comments on, but I also think it's ready for review.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/34257 | txgraph: deterministic optimal transaction order by sipa  Pull Request #34257  bitcoin/bitcoin  GitHub
That's it for me, I think.
#topic Net Split WG Update (cfields)
No update this week.
Skipping Silent Payments but I can report the scanning approaches discussion is pretty active currently at https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/issues/1799
Anything else to discuss?

I did some work on that touches cluster mempool primarily modifying GetMainStagingDiagram to populate refs https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/master...ismaelsadeeq:bitcoin:01-2026-detect-fee-increase-cleanup it's useful to compute chunk Id after mempool update. I am planning to use chunk Id in package aware fee estimator and block template cache, I  have a wip branch that uses these refs. Not sure whether I
should combine open this as standalone or combine the branch above with changes that actually use it cc sipa
This branch is ready I think, I've fuzzed it for a day. But the other branch is not ready yet
hi
abubakarsadiq: will have a look
thanks sipa. That's it from me.
